definition: difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
erhua variant of 差一點|差一点[cha4 yi1 dian3]

sentences.english: The monster had all but wrecked the ship.
sentences.chinese: 那妖物差一點毀了這條船。

sentences.english: On the quiz, my son was a bit weak on history.
sentences.chinese: 我兒子的歷史成績在測試中稍差一點兒。

sentences.english: Jack cycled too fast and almost ran down a school boy near the park.
sentences.chinese: 傑克車騎得太快了，在公園附近差一點撞倒一小學生。

sentences.english: I told him that he had nearly caused a bad accident.
sentences.chinese: 我對他說他差一點造成一起惡性事故。

sentences.english: I just avoided running over the cat.
He escapes into the elevator just before Lincoln can catch him.
sentences.chinese: 狙擊手逃進了電梯裏，林肯差一點就抓住了他。

sentences.english: We thought we had captured the spy, but he is slippery as an eel.
sentences.chinese: 那個間諜實在太狡猾，我們差一點就逮到他。

sentences.english: As the steamer came near to the landing-place, it began to slacken speed.
sentences.chinese: 因爲汽船差一點就要登陸地方，它開始減少速度。

sentences.english: When an accident nearly happens, we say it is a close shave .
sentences.chinese: 當車禍差一點發生的時候，我們說那是九死一生。

sentences.english: Of course, then you were nearly crushed to death in front of my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 那天，就在我的眼皮底下你差一點兒被車軋死。

sentences.english: I liked the deluxe edition, but I could afford only a second best.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡精裝版，但我只買得起一本稍差一點的。

sentences.english: The boy was nearly run over by a car.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩差一點兒被汽車軋了。
我也差一點有可能失去你。

sentences.english: The right wrist of the sheriff was all but dislocated.
sentences.chinese: 郡長的右腕差一點脫了臼。

sentences.english: The accident just about finished him as a footballer.
sentences.chinese: 這次事故差一點結束了他的足球生涯。

sentences.english: I'm used to high quality and won't take second-best.
sentences.chinese: 我用慣高質量的東西，差一點兒的都不行。

definition: that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
see 沒關係|没关系[mei2 guan1 xi5]
